frontmatter.title: Beach of Los Alemanes (Zahara de los Atunes)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Los Alemanes (Zahara de los Atunes) - 1500-metre-long beach. Hard to reach due to the closeness of the mountains.

frontmatter.title: Beach of El Palmar (Vejer de la Frontera)
frontmatter.description: Beach of El Palmar (Vejer de la Frontera) - 8km beach close to Conil de la Frontera. One of the least crowded beaches in Andalucia

frontmatter.title: Beach of Caños de Meca (Barbate)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Caños de Meca (Barbate) - Walk along the seashore, through the rocks to get to virgin little bays.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Los Muertos (Carboneras)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Los Muertos (Carboneras) - 1-km-long, 30-metre-wide virgin beach is completely unattended by tourists, as the path leading to it is steep and a 20-minute-walk from the nearest parking.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Monsul (San José)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Monsul (San José) - This beach’s iconic landmark is a lava formation right in the middle of the seashore

frontmatter.title: Beach of Los Genoveses (San José)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Los Genoveses (San José) - 2.4 km from the beach of Monsul. Small car park and unspoilt atmosphere.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Las Negras (Las Negras)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Las Negras (Las Negras) - Las Negras is a small fishermen’s village that owns a beach of the same name.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Cuesta Maneli (Almonte)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Cuesta Maneli (Almonte) - This virgin beach is part of the National Park of Doñana and lies between the more renowned beaches of Matalascañas and Mazagón.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Matalascañas (Matalascañas)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Matalascañas (Matalascañas) - 5 kilometres between the Torre de la Higuera and El Coto.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Mazagón (Mazagón)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Mazagón (Mazagón) - 9 km of beach that provides the inhabitants of Huelva with day trips.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Calahonda (Nerja)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Calahonda (Nerja) - 120-metre-long public beach in Nerja. Small beach but is equipped with all the facilities.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Maro (Maro)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Maro (Maro) - The 500-metre-long cave of Maro lies in the Natural Park of Acantilados de Maro, 5 km from Nerja.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Salobreña (Salobreña)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Salobreña (Salobreña) - The town of Salobreña welcomes various urban beaches, such as La Guardia and La Charca.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Calahonda (Motril)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Calahonda (Motril) - The Costa Tropical’s most southern town owns one of the most spectacular beaches in Andalusia, the beach of Calahonda.

frontmatter.title: Aqualand - Bahia de Cadiz
frontmatter.description: Aqualand - Bahia de Cadiz - Waterpark in El Puerto de Santa Maria near Cadiz with 9 rides.

frontmatter.title: Aqua Tropic Almunecar
frontmatter.description: Aqua Tropic Almunecar - The only saltwater waterslide park in Andalusia.

frontmatter.title: Aqua Velis Malaga
frontmatter.description: Aqua Velis Malaga - Costa del Sol Water Park with a variety of attractions. Also have a Virtual Reality Arcade VRFun.

frontmatter.title: Aquaola Granada
frontmatter.description: Aquaola Granada - The smallest waterpark in Granada, located near the provincial capital itself, with just nine ride.

frontmatter.title: Aquasierra Cordoba
frontmatter.description: Aquasierra Cordoba - This is Cordoba's only waterpark, with 7 rides.

frontmatter.title: Aquopolis Cartaya
frontmatter.description: Aquopolis Cartaya - This waterpark in Huelva province is the sister to the Aquopolis in Sevilla and have six rides.

frontmatter.title: Aquopolis Seville
frontmatter.description: Aquopolis Seville - Ten rides in this waterpark in Seville. There is a jacuzzi and a lake with a waterfall as well as VIP areas.

frontmatter.title: Bahia Park Algeciras
frontmatter.description: Bahia Park Algeciras - Eight rides in Algeciras a port town just outside Gibraltar and the Costa de la Luz.

frontmatter.title: Aquamijas
frontmatter.description: Aquamijas - Waterpark in Mijas Costa, near Fuengirola with waterslides and rides.

frontmatter.title: Paque Aquatico Vera Almeria
frontmatter.description: Paque Aquatico Vera Almeria - This water park is located in Vera in northern Almeria province, near Mojacar.

frontmatter.title: Red Tide Charter - Whale watching
frontmatter.description: Red Tide Charter - Whale watching - Boat trips and also fishing trips in Puerto Banus, Marbella. With all equipment, bait, licenses, beverages, etc included.

frontmatter.title: Dolphin Bombay Sapphire Fuengirola Malaga Sailing Boat Trips & Charters
frontmatter.description: Dolphin Bombay Sapphire Fuengirola Malaga Sailing Boat Trips & Charters - Bombay Saphire is a 13m sailing yacht with free drinks on all trips. They sail everyday for 1 or 2 hour trips.

frontmatter.title: FIRMM Whale Watching
frontmatter.description: FIRMM Whale Watching - Eco aware and educational dolphin and whale watching boat trips.we

frontmatter.title: Paloma Park
frontmatter.description: Paloma Park - This 200,000m2 park is located in the centre of Benalmadena and boasts beautiful garden areas as well as a large lake in the centre.

frontmatter.title: Tivoli World
frontmatter.description: Tivoli World - The Costa del Sol's longest running amusement park. Fun for all the family! Great variety of rides for all ages.

frontmatter.title: Costa Jump Marbella
frontmatter.description: Costa Jump Marbella - A trampoline park offering an enormous indoor arena filled with 50 interconnected wall to wall trampolines. There are also sister parks in Seville and Granada.

frontmatter.title: Costa Jump Granada
frontmatter.description: Costa Jump Granada - A trampoline park offering an enormous indoor arena filled with 50 interconnected wall to wall trampolines. There are also sister parks in Seville and Marbella.

frontmatter.title: Costa Jump Seville
frontmatter.description: Costa Jump Seville - A trampoline park offering an enormous indoor arena filled with 50 interconnected wall to wall trampolines. There are also sister parks in Marbella and Granada.

frontmatter.title: Go-Karting Marbella (Funny Beach)
frontmatter.description: Go Karting Marbella (Funny Beach) - There are a few locations along the Coast where you can test your driving skills. You can also try the Karting area on the roof of the Miramar shopping centre in Fuengirola or the karting at Plaza Mayor shopping centre next to Málaga airport.

frontmatter.title: Karting Experience Fuengirola (Miramar Shopping Centre)
frontmatter.description: Karting Experience Fuengirola (Miramar Shopping Centre) - There are a few locations along the Coast where you can test your driving skills. You can try Funny Beach in Marbella  or the karting at Plaza Mayor shopping centre next to Málaga airport.

frontmatter.title: Bigfoot Buggy Tours Costa Del Sol
frontmatter.description: Bigfoot Buggy Tours Costa Del Sol - Take an adventure in an off-road buggy and experience the breathtaking Andalusian countryside.

frontmatter.title: Muddy Adventures Buggy Tours
frontmatter.description: Muddy Adventures Buggy Tours - Take an adventure in an off-road buggy and experience the breathtaking Andalusian countryside.

frontmatter.title: Mijas Buggys
frontmatter.description: Mijas Buggys - Take an adventure in an off-road buggy and experience the breathtaking Andalucian countryside.

frontmatter.title: Water Parks in the Sea (Sotogrande)
frontmatter.description: Water Parks in the Sea (Sotogrande) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Puerto Banus)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Puerto Banus) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Mijas Costa, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Mijas Costa)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Mijas Costa) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Fuengirola)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Fuengirola) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Benalmadena)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Benalmadena) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa and Fuengirola.

frontmatter.title: Water Sport Playa Rafa - Jet Ski Rentals
frontmatter.description: Water Sport Playa Rafa - Jet Ski Rentals - Rent equipment for a thrilling adventure of parasailing, flyboarding, jet ski, wakeboarding and many more watersport activities.

frontmatter.title: Benal Rent Jetski
frontmatter.description: Benal Rent Jetski - Rent equipment for a thrilling adventure of parasailing, flyboarding, jetski, wakeboarding and many more watersport activities.

frontmatter.title: The Hawaiians SUP Center - Stand Up Paddle
frontmatter.description: The Hawaiians SUP Center - Stand Up Paddle - A water sport that the whole family can enjoy. SUP is a fun activity you can practice at various locations along the Costa del Sol.

frontmatter.title: La Mar de Bien (The world of good surf club) - Stand Up Paddle
frontmatter.description: La Mar de Bien (The world of good surf club) - Stand Up Paddle - A water sport that the whole family can enjoy. SUP is fun activity you can practice at various locations along the Costa del Sol.

frontmatter.title: Simply Diving
frontmatter.description: Simply Diving - A British-run PADI 5 Star Career Development and IDC Dive Centres in Spain. Catering for all scuba diving levels from beginner to advance. Sister school in Marbella.

frontmatter.title: Natura Dive Center
frontmatter.description: Natura Dive Center - Training divers at all levels - from the Open Water course that will allow you to start diving, to advanced training that will turn you into a diving instructor.

frontmatter.title: Simply Diving Marbella
frontmatter.description: Simply Diving Marbella - A British-run PADI 5 Star Career Development and IDC Dive Centres in Spain. Catering for all scuba diving levels from beginner to advance. Sister schoolin Torremolinos.

frontmatter.title: Scuba Tours
frontmatter.description: Scuba Tours - Sunset Beach Club hotel has their own PADI Dive Centre and Dive Shack onsite. They offer courses from beginner to advanced; they start off with lessons in the pool and then you can make your way out to one of the dive spots located just off the beach next to the hotel.

frontmatter.title: Nerjadiving
frontmatter.description: Nerjadiving - Training scuba divers at all levels.

frontmatter.title: Que Bowling Mijas
frontmatter.description: Que Bowling Mijas - A fun activity for all the family. There are a couple of bowling alleys in Andalusia.

frontmatter.title: Salon Varietés Theatre
frontmatter.description: Salon Varietés Theatre - An English speaking theatre in the centre of Fuengirola, that puts on a high level of performances. They also have pantos at Christmas. Book your tickets online.

frontmatter.title: Cines Teatro Goya
frontmatter.description: Cines Teatro Goya - Cinema showing the latest released movies in English.

frontmatter.title: Mk2 Cinesur Miramar
frontmatter.description: Mk2 Cinesur Miramar - This cinema is situated in the Miramar shopping centre and show a good range of English films (VOSE)

frontmatter.title: Yelmo Cines Plaza Mayor
frontmatter.description: Yelmo Cines Plaza Mayor - This cinema is situated in the Plaza Mayor shopping centre and show a good range of English films (VOSE)

frontmatter.title: Feria Arroyo de la Miel (Benalmadena) (June)
frontmatter.description: Ferria Arroyo de la Miel (Benalmadena) (June) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family

frontmatter.title: Estepona Feria (July)
frontmatter.description: Estepona Feria (July) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family

frontmatter.title: San Pedro de Alcantara Feria (October)
frontmatter.description: San Pedro de Alcantara Feria (October) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family

frontmatter.title: Kidz Kingdom Estepona
frontmatter.description: Kidz Kingdom Estepona - A softplay area for the younger kids. There are a whole range of different adventures for the little ones including slides and ball pits.

frontmatter.title: Aloha College
frontmatter.description: Aloha College  - Situated just outside of Marbella. Around 1000 students. Ages 3-18, co-ed day school. IGCSEs at age 16. 16-18 year olds do the IB diploma only.

frontmatter.title: Benalmadena International College
frontmatter.description: Benalmadena International College - Situated in Benalmadena. British school. Ages 3-18, co-ed day school. English Curriculum education with IGCSEs, AS and A Levels. For those not wanting to do A levels, the school has recently introduced vocational courses. info@bic-benal.com

frontmatter.title: Laude San Pedro International College
frontmatter.description: Laude San Pedro International College - Pupils aged 2-18, co-ed day school. Two form entry school. Pupils follow the English National Curriculum. IGCSEs at age 16. AS and A levels at 16-18.

frontmatter.title: Mayfair Academy
frontmatter.description: Mayfair Academy - Situated between Marbella and Estepona. Pupils aged 4-18, co-ed day school. Offers I.G.C.S.E. and A Levels.

frontmatter.title: St Anthony's College
frontmatter.description: St Anthony's College - Situated in Mijas Costa, perfect for people living in Mijas, Fuengirola, Coin and Alhaurin el Grande. Ages 3-18, co-ed day school; an officially recognised bilingual school offering an English curriculum with GCSEs at 16  and a wide range of A Levels at 18.

frontmatter.title: St George’s British School of Malaga
frontmatter.description: St George’s British School of Malaga - Close to Gibraltar, this is the southernmost international school on the Costa del Sol. Co-ed day (ages 3-18 years) and boarding (ages 11-18). It is the only international boarding school in Southern Spain).

frontmatter.title: Sunland International School
frontmatter.description: Sunland International School - Situated in Cartama, around 20km inland from Malaga. Co-ed day (ages 3-18 years) English curriculum, (SATS  ages 11 and 14, and IGCSEs).

frontmatter.title: Swans International School (Primary)
frontmatter.description: Swans International School (Primary) - Situated in Marbella. Children from ages 3-12. 300 pupils. English National Curriculum plus full Spanish Primary course in language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: Swans Sierra Blanca (Secondary School)
frontmatter.description: Swans Sierra Blanca (Secondary School) - Situated in Marbella. Co-ed day ages 11-18. It offers IGCSE, and since Sept 2008 provides the full IB diploma to Sixth Form students. It offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities.

frontmatter.title: Sunny View School
frontmatter.description: Sunny View School - Situated in Torremolinos, Co-ed day school. Ages 3-18. Pre-School, Primary and Secondary Schools. Complete English National Curriculum education, including GCSE from ages 14-16, A Levels from 16-18.

frontmatter.title: The British College Benalmadena
frontmatter.description: The British College Benalmadena - A 5 minute walk from Torremuelle train station on the Fuengirola - Malaga line. Co-ed (5-18 years) day school. English National Curriculum. Students do IGCSEs for ages 14-16, A/S Levels at 17, and A Levels at 18.

frontmatter.title: The English International College
frontmatter.description: The English International College - Situated at Las Chapas, close to Marbella. Around 500. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education. It provides SATS tests for ages 7, 11, and 14, IGCSEs and A Levels.

frontmatter.title: The International School Estepona (Primary School)
frontmatter.description: The International School Estepona (Primary School) - Situated in Benavista, Estepona, near Marbella. Children from ages 2-12. English National Curriculum. Montessori for ages 2-5.

frontmatter.title: Almunerca International School - Granada
frontmatter.description: Almunerca International School - Granada - Situated in Almuñécar on the Costa Tropical. English medium, independent Co-ed day school. Ages 3-19. Serves pupils from Torrox, Nerja, Motril and Granada.

frontmatter.title: Calpe School
frontmatter.description: Calpe School - Situated in San Pedro de Alcantara. Children from ages 2-10. English National Curriculum. Children are prepared for their transition from Foundation to Key Stage 1, to Key Stage 2 and then to secondary school.

frontmatter.title: CBS, The British School of Seville
frontmatter.description: CBS, The British School of Seville - Situated in Seville. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, but Spanish culture is also an integral part of the education system and subjects such as Spanish Language and Literature, History and Geography follow the same levels as the Spanish Educational System.

frontmatter.title: SEK-Alboran International School, Almeria
frontmatter.description: SEK-Alboran International School, Almeria - Situated in Almunerca. The school is located in the Almerimar residential estate (El Ejido), next to the Punta Entinas nature park and facing the sea. SEK-Alborán is one of the 9 schools making up SEK International Schools. Co-ed day (0-18 years). English National Curriculum education.

frontmatter.title: Sotogrande International School
frontmatter.description: Sotogrande International School - IS is an International Baccalaureate day and boarding school. Primary Years Programme (3-11), the Middle Years Programme (12-16) and the Diploma (16-18), plus outstanding language and learning support.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Seville
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Seville - Situated in Seville. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, n conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Almeria
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Almeria - Situated in Almeria. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, n conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Malaga
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Malaga - Situated in Malaga. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, in conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Almería
frontmatter.description: Museo de Almería - Archaeological Museum that maintains the largest collection of archaeological remains in Almeria. The museum also has a library which is open to researchers and the general public.

frontmatter.title: Centro Andaluz de la Fotografía
frontmatter.description: Centro Andaluz de la Fotografía - A photographic institution based in Almería that holds workshops and exhibitions related to Andalusian photographic heritage.

frontmatter.title: Museum of Cadiz
frontmatter.description: Museum of Cadiz - A museum located in Cadiz. Founded in 1970 after the merger of the Provincial Museum of Fine Arts and the Provincial Museum of Archaeology. The museum holds a collection of contemporary art and archaeology.

frontmatter.title: Museo Arqueológico Municipal de Jerez de la Frontera
frontmatter.description: Museo Arqueológico Municipal de Jerez de la Frontera - This is an archaeological museum on the Plaza del Mercado in Jerez de la Frontera, Cadiz.

frontmatter.title: Museo Arqueológico Municipal de El Puerto de Santa María
frontmatter.description: Museo Arqueológico Municipal de El Puerto de Santa María - A museum of fine art primarily composed of paintings by local contemporary artists and archaeology consisting of material assets from the prehistoric and historic past.

frontmatter.title: Museo Fundación Rafael Alberti
frontmatter.description: Museo Fundación Rafael Alberti -  A museum in El Puerto de Santa María, Spain that explores the life of the writer and poet Rafael Alberti.

frontmatter.title: Fundación NMAC
frontmatter.description: Fundación NMAC - A foundation that invites artists from all over the world to perform site-specific projects in the form of installations, sculptures and architectural projects in nature, photography, video and painting.

frontmatter.title: Archaeological Museum of Córdoba
frontmatter.description: Archaeological Museum of Córdoba - Learn about the history of Cordoba from the prehistoric days to the Middle Ages. Exhibitions are held often and includes Córdoba and its territory, Córdoba, power and centrality and Living in Córdoba.

frontmatter.title: Museum of Fine Arts in Córdoba
frontmatter.description: Museum of Fine Arts in Córdoba -  Situated in the same building as the Julio Romero de Torres Museum. It is a small museum with a collection of paintings by different authors, from the seventeenth century to modern times. The museum also have a few pieces by Julio Romero.

frontmatter.title: Museo Julio Romero de Torres de Córdoba
frontmatter.description: Museo Julio Romero de Torres de Córdoba - This museum is situated in a nineteenth century building recently renovated. The museum features the largest collection of the works of painter Julio Romero de Torres.

frontmatter.title: Museo Torre de la Calahorra de Córdoba
frontmatter.description: Museo Torre de la Calahorra de Córdoba - A museum of Andalusian daily life, wisdom, science, architecture and music. The visit lasts around 1 hour and are done with an audio guide system that are included in the entry fee.

frontmatter.title: Archaeological Museum of Granada
frontmatter.description: Archaeological Museum of Granada - The museum is situated in the Albaicin area of Granada. It is divided into three areas specialising in the different historical periods of the ancient history of Granada, with good bi-lingual explanation boards for each section.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Bellas Artes de Granada
frontmatter.description: Museo de Bellas Artes de Granada - This museum is located in the Palace of Carlos V, within the enclosure of the Alhambra. They emphasize important works of artists of s. XVI; among them, Alonso Cano and Machuca. The museum's art collections are mostly made up of paintings and sculptures, from the 15th to the 20th century.

frontmatter.title: Casa Museo de Manuel de Falla in Granada
frontmatter.description: Casa Museo de Manuel de Falla in Granada - It is located in the Anteque-ruela Alta, in the so-called Carmen del Ave María, in front of the Alhambra Palace Hotel. The house in which the great musician Manuel de Falla lived with his sister reopened its doors after an intense facelift. Manuel de Falla left Spain and left his piano, his work table, his bed and all this is exhibited here as well as many of the gifts he received, including Picasso's figurines, some paper bows, Miguel's of Unamuno, a painting by Huelva Daniel Vázquez Días, etc.

frontmatter.title: Casa Museo Federico García Lorca de Granada
frontmatter.description: Casa Museo Federico García Lorca de Granada - This museum was the house of poet García Lorca and the place where he wrote some of his work. It is located in the Vega de Granada and was once owned by his family. Inside the house you can see personal objects of the poet including photos, paintings and manuscripts. In this house he wrote Bodas de Sangre.

frontmatter.title: Museo Parque de las Ciencias de Granada
frontmatter.description: Museo Parque de las Ciencias de Granada - A museum and interactive science center with 70,000 square meters dedicated to cultural leisure, intelligent entertainment and educational entertainment. Located 15 minutes on foot from the historic center of the city, it receives more than 600,000 visitors a year and has established itself as the most visited museum in Andalusia. There is also a planetarium, an interactive museum, a butterfly park & a viewing tower.

frontmatter.title: Museo de la Alhambra
frontmatter.description: Museo de la Alhambra - This museum is located in the south wing of the ground floor of the palace of Charles V in the Alhambra . It houses objects, furnishings, books and architectural remains of Hispano-Muslim art dating from the mid- eighth century to the last years of the Nasrid culture.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Casa de los Tiros
frontmatter.description: Museo de Casa de los Tiros - This museum was named after the cannons that appear between the battlements at the top. This 16th century building, located in the Realejo district, stands out for its imposing façade with the five Greek gods. It currently houses the History Museum of Granada with permanent exhibitions about the city over the centuries.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Huelva
frontmatter.description: Museo de Huelva - Huelva Museum is housed in a modern building on the southern outskirts of the city. The museum also contains finds from the megalithic sites of La Zarcita at Santa Bárbara de las Casas and El Pozuelo at Zalamea la Real and Phoenician and Greek artifacts found during excavations in the city itself.

frontmatter.title: Centro de Arte Moderno y Contemporáneo Daniel Vázquez Díaz de Nerva
frontmatter.description: Centro de Arte Moderno y Contemporáneo Daniel Vázquez Díaz de Nerva - A museum located in the city of Huelva. It houses a collection of contemporary paintings by the artist Daniel Vázquez Díaz.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Jaén
frontmatter.description: Museo de Jaén - The museum is organised chronologically according to the history of Jaen, beginning with the prehistoric geography of the area, the advent of Neolithic man and the agrarian age, slowly segueing into Roman Spain, Moorish Spain and up to present day.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Artes y Costumbres del alto Guadalquivir
frontmatter.description: Museo de Artes y Costumbres del alto Guadalquivir- The museum is located in the Castillo de la Yedra, from which you have beautiful views of the mountains and the town.

frontmatter.title: CAC Málaga
frontmatter.description: CAC Málaga - The museum is located in an old market, with a collection of diverse and interesting contemporary art by numerous national authors, as well as some foreigners. It also offers temporary collections.

frontmatter.title: Museum Jorge Rando
frontmatter.description: Museum Jorge Rando - Open museum in a nice building about ten minutes walk from the center of Malaga. This is a museum that is unique in its genre in Spain. Expressionism dedicated to the painter Jorge Rando.

frontmatter.title: Museo del Grabado Español Contemporáneo de Marbella
frontmatter.description: Museo del Grabado Español Contemporáneo de Marbella - The museum is set in a building in the beautiful historical center of Marbella, and houses works by Miró, Saura, Picasso and Goya.

frontmatter.title: Fundación Picasso
frontmatter.description: Fundación Picasso - The museum is situated at the birthplace of Picasso, which is located at the Plaza de la Merced. It was opened in 1988 and you can see the works of Picasso from his early years, as well as those of his father José Ruiz Blasco.

frontmatter.title: Centro Andaluz de Arte Contemporáneo
frontmatter.description: Centro Andaluz de Arte Contemporáneo - An art museum set in an old monastery with changing exhibitions. The museum has more than 3,200 works of art, local to Seville. .

frontmatter.title: Museo Bellas Artes de Sevilla
frontmatter.description: Museo Bellas Artes de Sevilla - Located in the picturesque Plaza del Museo , a few steps from the Corte Inglés center, in the Plaza del Duque and next to Sierpes and Tetuán streets. The gallery is divided into 14 rooms arranged in chronological order. The religious theme is the predominant one and only the most modern works are separated from them.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Artes y Costumbres Populares de Sevilla
frontmatter.description: Museo de Artes y Costumbres Populares de Sevilla - Located in the center of María Luisa Park, in Plaza de América. The Museum houses a unique collection of objects used in traditional crafts, as well as everyday objects of family life. .

frontmatter.title: Archeological Museum of Seville
frontmatter.description: Archeological Museum of Seville - You can walk to this museum from the Cathedral through the Parque de Maria Luisa which is a lovely park. The museum has artifacts from the prehistoric period through to the Roman period. .

frontmatter.title: Museo Histórico Municipal de Écija
frontmatter.description: Museo Histórico Municipal de Écija - A museum located in the Benamejí Palace of the city of Écija, in the province of Seville. It exhibits one of the most valuable historical and archaeological heritage of Andalusia. Among the most outstanding pieces is the Amazona Herida , a Roman sculpture of two meters high.

frontmatter.title: Monday -  Villaneuva De La Concepcion morning food market
frontmatter.description: Monday -  Villaneuva De La Concepcion morning food market- Food market in Malaga open from 9am to 2pm

frontmatter.title: Monday - Marbella steet market
frontmatter.description: Monday - Marbella steet market - This market has 350+ stalls that sells fruit, vegetables, clothing, toys and locally-made arts and crafts..

frontmatter.title: Tuesday and Saturday Fuengirola Street market at Los Boliches.
frontmatter.description: Tuesday Fuengirola Street market at Los Boliches. - There is a market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. They are not identical markets in fact very different. Tuesdays would appeal to the typical tourists. New shoes, clothes, replica goods, handbags, football club shirts etc. Saturday is mainly second hand, used items sale.

frontmatter.title: Friday Market Sabinillas
frontmatter.description: Friday Market Sabinillas - Small market by the sea, many items for sale but in particular excellent for fruit and vegetables

frontmatter.title: Wednesday - Estepona market
frontmatter.description: Wednesday - Estepona market - Small market with stalls that are a great mix of items from aromatic spices, baby clothes, bedding, toys, shoes and jewellery, with fantastic choices for tourists and locals alike.

frontmatter.title: Thursday Alhaurin el Grande street market
frontmatter.description: Thursday Alhaurin el Grande street market - Small street market where you can buy mainly clothes and shoes. There is also a stall selling fruit and vegetables. Free parking is available in the area.

frontmatter.title: Wednesday- Alhaurin de la Torre street market
frontmatter.description: Tuesday- Alhaurin de la Torre street market - Street market in the old town every Wednesday from 9am to 2pm.

frontmatter.title: Thursday - San Pedro de Alcántara Market
frontmatter.description: Thursday - San Pedro de Alcántara Market - Located at the San Pedro de Alcántara fairground, this market is a food and flea market comprising of around 230 stalls.

frontmatter.title: Thursday- Torremolinos street market
frontmatter.description: Thursday- Torremolinos street market - The market is in the Sports/Cultural area behind the Town Hall. Mostly sells clothes, underwear, and some Moroccan leather goods.

frontmatter.title: Sunday - Coin - Organic Market
frontmatter.description: Sunday - Coin - Organic Market - This market is situated beside La Trocha shopping centre to the north of the town centre and sells organic fruit and vegetables.

frontmatter.title: Sunday - Coin weekly carboot market
frontmatter.description: Sunday - Coin weekly carboot market - Every Sunday in the parking of the La Trocha shopping center.

frontmatter.title: Saturday - Marbella - Ecological Market
frontmatter.description: Saturday - Marbella - Ecological Market - On the first Saturday of every month between 10am and 2pm, Marbella’s Alameda Park is the setting for an ecological market. Stalls sell locally sourced, environmentally friendly produce at competitive prices, and the green spaces of the Alameda make browsing here a pleasure.

frontmatter.title: Beach of Bolonia (Tarifa)
frontmatter.description: Beach of Bolonia - 4 km beach on Costa de la Luz in Cadiz Province. Great for windsurfing.
tags: Top things to do in Cadiz

frontmatter.title: Aqualand Torremolinos
frontmatter.description: Aqualand Torremolinos - Waterpark in Torremolinos with numerous waterslides and rides,
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Bioparc Zoo
frontmatter.description: Bioparc Zoo - Small, but very well designed and laid out  zoo in Fuengirola.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Selwo Marina
frontmatter.description: Selwo Marina - The only Dolphinarium in Andalusia and one of the most popular attractions located in in the centre of Arroyo de la Miel (Benalmadena)
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Zoo de Castellar
frontmatter.description: Zoo de Castellar - Not your typical zoo, but a place where you can interact with the animals.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Selwo Aventura Wildlife Park in Estepona
frontmatter.description: Selwo Aventura Wildlife Park in Estepona - The largest wildlife park on the Costa del Sol. See large animals roaming in the wild.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Sealife Aquarium
frontmatter.description: Sealife Aquarium - Vist this aquarium in Benalmadena to See sharks, jellyfish, giant turtles, sea rays, a giant Pacific octopus and lots of other fascinating underwater creatures.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: La Bateria Park
frontmatter.description: La Bateria Park - A park in Torremolinos with plenty of green areas, playgrounds and a carousel. You can also hire paddle boats on the lake.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Butterfly Park
frontmatter.description: Butterfly Park - Located just outside Benalmadena, this 2000m2 complex features butterflies flying freely in their very own tropical paradise with plants, flowers and waterfalls.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Crocodile Park
frontmatter.description: Crocodile Park - The Crocodile Park is home to more than 200 crocodiles. Visits include a guided tour and live demonstrations.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Fuengirola Zipline
frontmatter.description: Fuengirola Zipline - Just below Sohail Castle in Fuengirola an adventure company offers zipline rides across the river.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Kart & Fun Malaga (Plaza Mayor)
frontmatter.description: Kart & Fun Malaga (Plaza Mayor) - There are a few locations along the Coast where you can test your driving skills. You can try FunnyBeach in Marbella, the Karting area on the roof of the Myramar shopping centre in Fuengirola.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga.

frontmatter.title: Quadbike safari costa del sol
frontmatter.description: Quadbike safari costa del sol - Take an adventure in an off-road buggy and experience the breathtaking Andalusian countryside.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Pedalo Fun
frontmatter.description: Pedalo Fun - You can rent a pedalo for half an hour or an hour along most beaches along the coast.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Pirate Parasailing & Water Sports Fuengirola
frontmatter.description: Pirate Parasailing & Water Sports Fuengirola  - If you are a thrill-seeker and would like to experience the beautiful views of the Costa del Sol's coastline, try parasailing. This is not for those of you afraid of heights.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Jet Watersport Fuengirola / Parasailing / Jetski Rental / Flyboard
frontmatter.description: Jet Watersport Fuengirola / Parasailing / Jetski Rental / Flyboard - Rent equipment for a thrilling adventure of parasailing, flyboarding, jet ski, wakeboarding and many more watersport activities.If you are a thrill-seeker and would like to experience the beautiful views of the Costa del Sol's coastline, try parasailing. This is not for those of you afraid of heights.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Marbella Jetski
frontmatter.description: Marbella Jetski - Rent equipment for a thrilling adventure of parasailing, flyboarding, jetski, wakeboarding and many more watersport activities.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Big Fun Plaza Mayor Bowling
frontmatter.description: Big Fun Plaza Mayor Bowling - A fun activity for all the family. There are a couple of bowling alleys in Andalusia.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Fuengirola Adventure Golf
frontmatter.description: Fuengirola Adventure Golf - Lots of courses to play and some very tricky ones. There is also a good snack bar available.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Mini Golf Park
frontmatter.description: Mini Golf Park - Great golf course with 18 different challenges. Also has pool tables and arcade games.

frontmatter.title: Playa Mini Golf
frontmatter.description: Playa Mini Golf - Now the Blue Kiwi and Mini Golf. In 2018 they are celebrating 20 years which is a testament to their presence in Benalmadena.

frontmatter.title: Marbella Feria (June)
frontmatter.description: Marbella Feria (June) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Malaga Feria (August)
frontmatter.description: Malaga Feria (August - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Torremolinos Feria (September)
frontmatter.description: Torremolinos Feria (September) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Mijas Feria (September)
frontmatter.description: Mijas Feria (September) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Ferris Wheel in Malaga
frontmatter.description: Ferris Wheel in Malaga - For great views of Malaga City, take a ride on the ferris wheel located at the Malaga Port. The ferris wheel is 70 metres high and acommodate up to 8 people in a cabin.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Benalmadena Cable Car
frontmatter.description: Benalmadena Cable Car - For spectacular views of the Costa del Sol, a trip in the cable car is fun for all the family. At the top, you can also enjoy a bird of prey exhibition.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Archaeological Museum of Linares
frontmatter.description: Archaeological Museum of Linares - This museum is located in Casa del Torreón, an old 17th-century palace that belonged to the Dávalos family.

frontmatter.title: Archaeological Museum of Úbeda
frontmatter.description: Archaeological Museum of Úbeda - The museum is small and tucked away a little bit but close to the main square in old town of Úbeda. It houses really great items that have been uncovered in the local area.

frontmatter.title: Museo de Málaga
frontmatter.description: Museo de Málaga - Set in a beautiful building with lots of interesting pieces of art and archaeology. This museum is a must-visit in Málaga. It takes you back through 2,000+ years of local history. The museum is well-displayed with detailed information panels in Spanish and English..
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Museo Picasso Málaga
frontmatter.description: Museo Picasso Málaga - Featuring two hundred and eighty-five works collected by the MPM collection encompass Picasso's revolutionary innovations, as well as the wide variety of styles, materials and techniques he used. Audio commentary is free and a must. The museum features work that Picasso kept private within his family.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Carmen Thyssen Museum
frontmatter.description: Carmen Thyssen Museum - An art museum in Malaga that focus mainly on 19th-century Spanish painting, predominantly Andalusian, based on the collection of Carmen Cervera, the third wife of Baron Hans Heinrich Thyssen-Bornemisza.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Centre Georges Pompidou Málaga
frontmatter.description: Centre Georges Pompidou Málaga - The Pompidou de Málaga is located at the end of the promenade. A museum of contemporary art well thought out and with some very remarkable works of art. k
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Friday Benalmadena street market
frontmatter.description: Friday Benalmadena street market - The Friday market at Tivoli is large and very busy. You will find anything you are looking for, including clothes, fruit and vegetables, etc.

frontmatter.title: Alhambra & Generalife
frontmatter.description: Alhambra & Generalife - The Alhambra is one of the must see places in the world and is an Andalusian palastine city located in Granada. It consists of  a set of palaces , gardens and a fortress (Alcazaba). The Alcazaba is a fascinating area with great views of the city on one side and of the snow-covered Sierra Nevada mountains on the other. The eagle-eyed can pick out the famous viewpoint Mirador de San Nicolas in the cityscape.
tags: Top things to do in Granada

frontmatter.title: Mosque - Cathedral Cordoba
frontmatter.description: Mosque - Cathedral Cordoba - Also known as the Great Mosque of Córdoba, this magnificent mosque symbolizes the many religious changes Cordoba has undergone over the centuries. The structure is regarded as one of the most accomplished monuments of Moorish architecture.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Real Alcazar Seville
frontmatter.description: Real Alcazar Seville - This monument were declared as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987 and represents the historical evolution of the city of Seville in the last millennium. Influences by different cultures is highly noticeable starting from the Arabic period, late Middle Ages Mudéjar right through to the Renaissance, Baroque and the XIX century.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Cathedral & Giralda
frontmatter.description: Cathedral & Giralda - The Cathedral of Seville is a Roman Catholic cathedral and was the most visited monument in the city of Seville in 2018. It was registered in 1987 by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site, along with the adjoining Alcázar palace complex and the General Archive of the Indies.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Alcazaba
frontmatter.description: Alcazaba - This fortress palace whose name in Arabic means citadel is one of the historical monuments of the city, a space visited for combining history and beauty in the same place. Its military component makes it one of the most important Muslim works preserved in Spain.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Castillo de Gibralfaro
frontmatter.description: Castillo de Gibralfaro - Located next to the historic center on top of a hill next to the Alcazaba in a superb watchtower on the Mediterranean. The Castle of Gibralfaro has a Phoenician origin when it was a lighthouse that stood on a hill called Gibralfaro, later the Arabs reconverted it into a fortress that, later, would be modified to become Alcázar.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Synagogue
frontmatter.description: Synagogue - This small synagogue is situated in the Jewish Quarter of Córdoba and was built in 1315. It was possibly the private synagogue of a wealthy man, as indicated by its small size. Another possibility is that this was the synagogue of a trade guild, which converted a residence or one of the work rooms into the synagogue.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Alcazar
frontmatter.description: Alcazar - The Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos complex is an old fortress that became the residence of the Catholic Monarchs for eight years and is made up of four walls finished at the corners by four towers. Essential to see in Cordoba, historical / cultural monument of the first order, beautiful views of the city and splendid gardens
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Cathedral of Malaga
frontmatter.description: Cathedral of Malaga - A beautiful Cathedral and a must see when in Málaga. Close to the Alcazaba and you get an audio guide at the entrance.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Cuevas de Nerja
frontmatter.description: Cuevas de Nerja - If you're looking for something different to do in Nerja then Cueva De Nerja are well worth a visit. There are a number of steps inside the caves so not suitable for anyone with walking difficulties. The numbers entering are managed so are never too crowded. The stalagmites and stalagtites are amazing to see.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Capilla Real
frontmatter.description: Capilla Real - Located at the foot of the Gran Vía you find this spectacular Renaissance cathedral with its baroque touches, which stands out for having 5 naves. You can enjoy the wonderful view of the Royal Chapel and the Cathedral.
tags: Top things to do in Granada

frontmatter.title: Caminito del Rey
frontmatter.description: Caminito del Rey - El Caminito del Rey is a passage built on the walls of the Los Gaitanes gorge, a pedestrian walkway or hiking trail of more than 3 kilometers long. It is attached to the rock inside a canyon hanging up to 105 meters high above the river.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Alcazaba Almeria
frontmatter.description: Alcazaba Almeria - Walled city, with stunning views of both the city of Almeria and the coast. You can walk through its gardens, there are usually free activities or markets taking place in the grounds.
tags: Top things to do in Almeria

frontmatter.title: Archivo de Indias
frontmatter.description: Archivo de Indias - Located in the historic center of Seville, is the general building of the Archivo de Indias. This beautiful building holds a lot of history and its main purpose was to protect the documentation of the Spanish territories in colonial America.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: El Torcal
frontmatter.description: El Torcal - Without a doubt one of the most attractive parks in Spain. Well taken care of natural park with hiking trails, signposted and perfect access in shuttles. Having two circuits, one short, 45 minutes and another long, about 2 hours, allows you to choose and enjoy this special place.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Real Maestranza
frontmatter.description: Real Maestranza - The Bullring of the Real Maestranza de Caballería de Sevilla is a monument considered to be the most important square relevant to the greatest bullfighting tradition in Spain. One of the most relevant collections of bullfighting art at universal level are kept here.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Muelle Carabelas
frontmatter.description: Muelle Carabelas -  A museum in Palos de la Frontera, in the province of Huelva that exhibits replicas of Christopher Columbus's boats for his first voyage to the Americas, the Niña, the Pinta, and the Santa María.

frontmatter.title: Dolmens Antequera
frontmatter.description: Dolmens Antequera - The Antequera Dolmens Site is a cultural heritage ensemble comprising 3 cultural monuments (the Dolmen of Menga, Dolmen of Viera and Tholos of El Romeral) and 2 natural mountain features (the Peña de los Enamorados and El Torcal) in and near the city of Antequera in Andalusia, Spain. Declared an UNESCO World Heritage site in 2016.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Medina al-Zahra
frontmatter.description: Medina al-Zahra - Medina Azahara (Madinat al-Zahra) was the most beautiful example of the al-andalus splendor. Madīnat al-Zahrā', was an Umayyad residence between the tenth and eleventh centuries B.C. The archaeological site is located at the foot of the Sierra Morena, about 5 km west of Cordoba.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: La Gruta de las Maravillas
frontmatter.description: La Gruta de las Maravillas - The grotto is located in the urban helmet of Aracena, to the north of the province of Huelva. Extensive caves with a lakes and wonderful formations.

frontmatter.title: Italica
frontmatter.description: Italica - The birth place of two Roman Emperors, Trajan and Hadrian, this place is still being excavated. It resembles Pompei but on a smaller scale. The amphitheater is really impressive. Of course for Game of Thrones fans, it is where they shot the dragon pit scenes.

frontmatter.title: Metropol Parasol
frontmatter.description: Metropol Parasol - Las Setas de Sevilla , also known as the Metropol Parasol project by the architect Jürgen Mayer, is the largest wooden structure in the world and its construction was carried out with the aim of renovating the Plaza de la Encarnación in the city of Seville.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Baelo Claudia
frontmatter.description: Baelo Claudia - The ancient Roman city of Baelo Claudia is located in the inlet of Bologna , in the town of Bologna , about 22 km northwest of the city of Tarifa , in the province of Cádiz ( Spain ). It is located within the current Natural Park of the Strait . The study of its architectural remains shows its Roman origin at the end of the 2nd century BC.

frontmatter.title: Museo Ruso
frontmatter.description: Museo Ruso - The Russian Museum Collection Center St. Petersburg Malaga is a seat of the Russian State Museum located in the former Royal Tobacco Factory in Malaga. Next to the exhibition halls, the center has an auditorium, three screening rooms, children's workshops, reading room with reference books, a virtual museum headquarters, cafeteria and shop.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Palacio Viana
frontmatter.description: Palacio Viana - Located a short walk from the centre of Cordoba. This aristocratic palace is full of art and antiques and although the guide's presentation is in Spanish there are English information sheets in the rooms.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Casa Pilatos
frontmatter.description: Casa Pilatos - The House of Pilate (whose name has several theories) is located in the historic center of Seville, in the neighborhood of the Jewish quarter. It is the prototype of a typical Andalusian palace, built in the sixteenth century, which currently belongs to the Foundation of the Ducal House of Medinacelli.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Teatro Romano
frontmatter.description: Teatro Romano - This theatre is located at the entrance to the Alcazaba. This is a small theatre by Roman standards but nevertheless still impressive. There are lots of informational readings around the site.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Torre del Oro
frontmatter.description: Torre del Oro - This "Tower of Gold" is a 36 meter high tower that are located on the left bank of the rio-guadalquivir, in the city of Seville. It is right next to the bullring of the Real Maestranza. It's name is owed to the golden reflections produced by the tiles that covers it.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Museo Rio Tinto
frontmatter.description: Museo Rio Tinto - The museum describes the geology and history behind the Rio Tinto company's mining operations in the area. Most of the information is in Spanish, but it is not too difficult to understand, particularly if you have some prior knowledge of geology and mining. Just under an hour's drive from Huelva you can spend an enjoyable day at the Rio Tinto Museum and Pena de Hierro (a disused mine), take a ride on a mining train and walk round one of the old English houses.

frontmatter.title: Automobile Museum
frontmatter.description: Automobile Museum - This is a museum in Malaga with an unusual mix of vintage cars and designer clothes. It is a worthwhile visit if you have any interest in vintage cars. Great selection and well laid out with a grand selection of fashion from the same era.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Baños Califales
frontmatter.description: Baños Califales  - The baths are located a few meters from the Cathedral-Mosque and are one of the only remaining parts of the original Muslim Alcázar. It gives you a great sense of Moorish times in the region, as the information tables provide details of how well they operated, along with their social and religious history.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Bullring Ronda
frontmatter.description: Bullring Ronda - Although not the largest by capacity, Plaza de Toros is the largest ring in Spain, and possibly the world. Even if you disapprove of bullfighting this is a great tour for the history and the architecture.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Gonzalez Byass Bodegas
frontmatter.description: Gonzalez Byass Bodegas - Jerez is the home to the largest sherry producer in the world. Gonzalez-Byass originated in 1835 and continues to be a family-run business.

frontmatter.tag: Top things to do in Cordoba
frontmatter.name: Top things to do in Cordoba
